member.name: T:JetBrains.Platform.VisualStudio.SinceVs14.Shell.Imaging.IVsIconImageMonikers
member.summary: Maps R# icon ids into VS image monikers

member.name: M:JetBrains.Platform.VisualStudio.SinceVs14.Shell.Imaging.IVsIconImageMonikers.GetImageMoniker(JetBrains.UI.Icons.IconId)
member.summary: If there is no moniker for the icon, returns an invalid image moniker (Guid.Empty : 0) (see Microsoft.VisualStudio.Imaging.ImageLibrary.InvalidImageMoniker).

member.name: T:JetBrains.Platform.VisualStudio.SinceVs14.Shell.Install.VsEmitHighResolutionIconsSinceVs14
member.summary: Emits high resolution icons for VS14 CTP3+.
member.remarks: To emit high resolution icons we need to: 1) Store xaml/baml and/or png icons to the package resources. 2) Create imagemanifest-file and put it to the folder where pkgdef and vsixmanifest reside. 3) Mark command buttonss with the new "IconIsMoniker" attribute in package's CTO (see CtoBuilder and VsctCommandFlags).

member.name: T:JetBrains.Platform.VisualStudio.SinceVs14.Shell.Install.VsRepairRoslynSquigglesSinceVs14
member.summary: Before Wave03 EAP5 we used internal VS registry key to remove Roslyn squiggles (JFYI nowadays we just make the squiggles layer transparent). If the registry value stuck in the off state, users have no chance to see the squiggles. We had better not to delete the key, because we don't know who has created it. We just turn it on, if it exists.
